availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nathaniel Wickliffe, Jr. (Bardstown, Nelson County, Kentucky, soldier (C.S.A.))

body.p: Bardstown, Nelson County, Kentucky, military (C.S.A). Kentucky native. Married to Josephine Wickliffe c.1860. Appointed Second Lieutenant Ninth Infantry (U.S.A.) on June 30, 1855. Lieutenant in Ninth Infantry (U.S.A) in Lexington, Kentucky on July 7, 1855. Lieutenant (U.S.A) in Nelson County, Kentucky in 1860. Promoted to First Lieutenant Ninth Infantry (U.S.A.) on March 15, 1861. Resigned from post with Ninth Infantry on May 17, 1861. Joined the Los Angeles Rifles (C.S.A.) June 1861. Appointed Assistant Adjutant General for Albert Sidney Johnston’s Western Department (C.S.A.) staff in 1861. Assigned command of Fifth Mississippi Cavalry (C.S.A.) on May 12, 1864. Relieved from position on August 15, 1864.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 181. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, Bardstown, p. 72. Letters Received by the Office of the Adjutant General Main Series, 1822-1860, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M619, roll 0530. Fred Radford Brown, History of the Ninth U.S. Infantry, 1799-1909 (Chicago, IL: R.R. Donnelley & Sons Co., 1909), 746.Gene C. Armistead, “California and the Civil War, California’s Confederate Militia: The Los Angeles Mounted Rifles,” originally published in Confederate Veteran, revised 2003 edition, (accessed via California State Military Museum website)http://www.militarymuseum.org/LosAngelesMountedRifles2.html. Dunbar Rowland, Military History of Mississippi, 1803-1898: Taken from the Official and Statistical Register of the State of Mississippi, 1908 (Spartanburg, S.C.: Reprint Co., 1978), 415, 417, (accessed via Google books). William Preston Johnston, _The Life of General Albert Sidney Johnston, His Services in the Armies of the United States, The Republic of Texas, and the Confederate States (New York, NY: D. Appleton and Company, 1878), 317, (accessed via Google books).
